summary: IRS's new program pursues the tax debts that IRS's collectors aren't—by contracting with private collection agencies. This program raises concerns about effectiveness and taxpayer risk, as did similar programs in the past. For example, IRS's private collectors recovered less than 2% of over $5 billion in debts. Analyzing these results could help IRS make the program more effective. IRS also hasn't fully assessed potential taxpayer...
title: Tax Debt Collection Contracts: IRS Analysis Could Help Improve Program Results and Better Protect Taxpayers
